value: Design for an Embroidered or Woven Border of the "Fabrique de St. Ruf"

label: Description
value: A chain of perspectively shown rings of which leaf boughs form the outside; the insides show dots between lines. Seven rings are shown.

label: Description

Design for the Embroidery of a Man's Waistcoat of Pattern No. 504 of the "Fabrique de St. Ruf"

label: Description
value: Left bottom corner; slightly rising bottom edge. Row of flower scrolls along the edges. The letter "A" on a support and in a palmette framing forms the central motif in the bottom part. Festoons are suspended from the top center of the palmette and lacy flower boughs are rising from its bottom. A bunch of flowers rises from the bottom center on the pocket.

label: Description
value: A left bottom corner with slightly rising bottom edge. Hatching and rinceaux, composed of bends and leaves along the outer edge. The pocket is bordered by strings of beads and mossy arches forming ovoids. Leaf boughs hang into the pocket and into the field beneath it.

Design for Embroidery, Gentleman's Waistcoat Pocket

label: Description
value: Design for the embroidery on a man's waistcoat or gilet. A grey dog and three grey geese appear below a pocket flap, surrounded by stalks of wheat. The dog and geese are separated by a bunch of pink and blue flowers. Two red flowers appear to the left of the dog. The bottom edges are bordered with purple and pink flowers, and small green leaves and purple dots line the edge of the flap.

Design for an Embroidery or Woven Fabric of the "Fabrique de St. Ruf"

label: Description
value: The column as in 1920-36-325 rises between roses from a pierced rock through which part of it is shown. Beehives stand in the bottom corner. A coat of arms is sketched in the shield. A crayon "R K," on the base. Garlands with disks in the corners and in the center of the sides form an oblong frame.

Design for an Embroidered Waistcoat, Pattern 518 of the "Fabrique de St. Ruf"

label: Description
value: Border motifs are shown along the edges. A waved garland is intertwined with the cord bordering the pocket on top. Plants are obliquely shown in the bittom corners of the pocket. Plants grow over a stylized U-shaped garland suspended from festoons on top. "P 518" is written in ink in the lower part of the design.

value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt; 1920: acquired by Museum

value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Design for the Embroidered Decoration of a Main's Waistcoat of the "Fabrique de St. Ruf"

label: Description
value: The design showing a piece off the upright edge over the oblique one is irregularly pentagonal and formed by a green strip. The edges of the flap of the pocket are green with points along the inner sides. From the bottom edge rise three leaf boughs and four stems which pass between the top edge into the field of the waistcoat. It shows similarly treated edges as the flap and a leaf garland along them.

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY; 1920: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: The pentagonal design similar to 1920-36-42. Green edges with strips of triangles along those of the waistcoat and the lateral and bottom ones of the flap of the pocket. Boughs rise from them. A plant and festoons decorate the flap, festoons the field beneath the pocket. The upper field is intended to show rows of boughs of different designs and directions in alternate horizontal rows.

value: Brush and gouache, watercolor on white laid paper

Design for an Embroidered Border of a Man's Waistcoat of the "Fabrique de St. Ruf"

label: Description
value: Beside a strip, an ovolo and a bead chain at left are oblongs, the buttonholes, from the right top corners of which bunches of flowers rise obliquely; every other includes a rose bough. From the corners of the oblongs start boughs in straight and oblique directions, forming a panel containing bunches of flowers of different colorings in alternate rows. Incised bottom right: "b…Nau ()?) f/fait"

value: Brush and gouache on glazed tracing paper

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Design for the Embroidery of the Left Bottom Corner of a Man's Waistcoat of the "Fabrique de St. Ruf"

label: Description
value: The lateral and bottom edges of the flap of the pocket and the edges of the waistcoat show a moulding with a black and white strip separated by a zigzag line. Two insects, two flower boughs, a bunch of flowers, and leaves are shown on the flap. From the bottom edge of the pocket are suspended a drapery festoon with a bunch of fruit and a flower bough. Plants grow from the edge.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and gouache on glazed tracing paper

label: Provenance

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Design for the Embroidery of the Left Bottom Corner of a Man's Waistcoat of the "Fabrique de St. Ruf"

label: Description
value: Strips and rows of pierced ovoidal seeds and beads are shown at the lateral and bottom edges of the flap of the pocket and at the edges of the waistcoat. Sprays composed of flowers and gems decorate the flap and the field beneath the pocket. Written in ink, top center: "P1053".
